title: API Penetration Test
description: A penetration tester is tasked with finding security flaws in a new REST API.

tasks.description: Use an API testing tool to enumerate all available API endpoints and parameters.
tasks.expected_outcome: Tester successfully maps out the API's attack surface.

tasks.description: Test for authentication and authorization flaws by attempting to access endpoints without proper credentials or as a different user.
tasks.expected_outcome: Tester discovers an endpoint that returns data belonging to another user, demonstrating a Broken Object Level Authorization (BOLA) flaw.

tasks.description: Document the vulnerability with a proof-of-concept exploit and report it to the development team.
tasks.expected_outcome: Tester provides a clear, actionable report that allows developers to fix the flaw.
